lead_paragraph: Usain Bolt of Jamaica is aiming toward a 100-meter showdown with the reigning world champion Tyson Gay at the Reebok Grand Prix on May 31 in New York, according to Bolt’s coach, Glen Mills. No official announcement was made by the Grand Prix, but Mills said Bolt “is scheduled to race Tyson Gay in New York.” Bolt was timed in the second-fastest 100 in history at the Jamaican International Invitational in Kingston on Saturday. His 9.76 was 0.02 seconds off the world record held by his fellow Jamaican Asafa Powell.
